row.field:
1. Create a new HTML5 project ("HTML5 Application" type)
  2. Finish wizard with default values
  3. After project is created, go to Tools|Options|Misc.|Mobile Platforms and set up path to Android SDK
  4. Use browser picker in main toolbar and set browser to Cordova (Android emulator)
  5. Run project
  6. Android simulator should be either started or IDE should tell you to start simulator so if necessary start it and once it is ready, confirm dialog in IDE
  7. IDE asks you to setup resources, confirm
  8. New files/folders are created in your project (config.xml etc.)
  9. Wait for run process to finish and make sure it won't fail.
  10. Right on project node and check that 3 new actions are there: Clean, Build, Clean & Build
  11. Open project properties and select Cordova
Panel shows Cordova resources, application is started in Android Emulator. Try Clean & Build action. If possible, repeat these steps also for iOS Device

1. Create a new HTML5 project, now "Cordova Application" type
  2. Finish wizard with default values
  3. Project is being created with template files, wait for this process to successfully finish
  4. Browser picker shows Cordova (Android device) as target browser (on Mac, iOS Simulator is displayed)
  5. Connect your device, enable USB debugging and run project. If you don't have Android device, use again Emulator instead
Application is installed on device and starts OK. Again try Clean & Build action. If possible, repeat these steps also for iOS Simulator

1. Create a new HTML5 project, "Cordova Application" type
  2. Finish wizard with default values
  3. Open project properties and select Cordova category
  4. Switch to Plugins panel
  5. All core plugins are enabled (in right column)
  6. Try to remove some plugins by selecting them in Selected column and pressing left arrow button
  7. Press OK
Open nbproject/plugin.properties and make sure that list of plugins fits selected plugins in project properties

1. Use project from previous case
  2. Open project properties and select Cordova category
  3. Switch to Plugins panel
  4. Try to add some plugins to the project
  5. Press OK
Open nbproject/plugin.properties and make sure that list of plugins fits selected plugins in project properties

1. Create a new HTML5 sample project "Cordova Maps Sample"
  2. Finish wizard with default values
  3. Open index.html and make sure that there is a script element pointing to cordova.js.
  4. Run project on any Cordova target
  5. Clean and build project

TS_74_LessSupport_coloring.png
  1. Open TS_74_LessSupport_sample.less file in editor and compare syntax highlighting with the picture above
Syntax highlighting is same as one the picture

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. type "d" and invoke code completion
Items like datalist, dd, div etc. are offered

1. Create a new LESS file and paste following 
  2.  
                    a {  
  
                    // cc here 
                    }
  3. Invoke code completion
CSS Properties are offered, like in css file

1. Create a new LESS file and paste following 
  2.  
                    a {  
  
                    color: // cc here 
                    }
  3. Invoke code completion
Values for color property are offered

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. Paste following into the file 
  3. @nice-blue: #5B83AD;
                    @light-blue: (@nice-blue + #111);
                    #header { 
                    color: @; 
                    }
  4. Invoke code completion after @ on inside header rule

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. Paste following into the file 
  3. .mixinA (@c){
                    border-top: dotted 1px black;
                    }
                    .mixinB {
                    border-top: dotted 1px black;
                    }
                    #menu a {
                    color: #111;
                    .
                    }
  4. Invoke code completion after the dot on inside the rule
Both mixins are offered, if you remove the dot and invoke cc again, only common CSS properties are offered

1. Create 3 new LESS files: A.less, B.less and partial.less
  2. Declare a mixin in both, B.less and partial.less file
  3. In A.less, paste following 
  4. @import "partial.less";
                    div {
                    color: #111;
                    .
                    }
  5. Invoke code completion after the dot on inside the rule
Mixin from included file is offered, not included is either not offered or with different color

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. Paste following 
  3. @rad:1;
                    .test(@radius){
                    border-radius: @
                    }
  4. Invoke code completion after the @ inside the mixin

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. Paste following 
  3. @oops:1;
                    .mixin(@oops2) {
                    color-2: @o;
                    }
  4. Invoke code completion after the @o inside the mixin
oops and oops2 should be offered (see issue 231777)

1. Create a new LESS file
  2. Paste following 
  3. @oops:1;
                    .mixin(@oops2) {
                    }
  4. Invoke code completion at empty line inside mixin
CSS Properties and HTML elements are offered. If you type something, list is reduced

1. Create a new Less file and in the same folder create a new folder "test" with another Less file inside
  2. type 
    @import ""
    in the first Less file
  3. invoke code completion inside the quotes
"List of files/folders in current directory is offered, type t to reduce the list to all starting with t. Finish completion for the test folder, press / and invoke cc again. File should be offered "

1. Use the files from previous case
  2. Press Ctrl+Left Click on value of the import statement
"Imported Less file is opened in editor"

1. Paste following code to less file 
  2. @attr:1;
                    @name:1;

                    .jejda(@test){
                    color: @test;
                    font-size: @attr;
                    }
                    .pre{    
                    .jejda(red);
                    }
Navigator shows variables and mixins, if variable is declared, it is bold

1. Create a new LESS file, all default values
  2. Edit the file and save
Upon first save, you are asked if you want to enable compile on save feature. If you press yes, then Project properties is opened

1. Create a new HTML5 project
  2. Open new file wizard, select Less file, press Next
  3. Check compile on save and let the default values for watched directories
  4. place new less file into public_html/less directory
  5. Edit created file and save it
Corresponding CSS file is created, if you change source less file, then CSS file is re-created

1. Create a new HTML5 project
  2. Open new file wizard, select LESS file, press Next
  3. Check compile on save and let the default values for watched directories
  4. place new less file into public_html/less directory
  5. Create new less file: public_html/less/view/partial.less
  6. Paste following into the less file in less directory (so not partial.less): 
  7. @import "view/partial.less";
  8. Create a simple CSS rule in partial.less
  9. save the file
"Parent" file with @imports is refreshed when imported file is modified and saved

1. Create a new HTML5 project
  2. Open project properties, enable Compile on Save for LESS in CSS Preprocessors and have 2 lines in watch field: 
                        /less/folder -> /css2
                    /less/       -> /css
  3. Create corresponding less files in both directories
  4. Edit them and save

1. Paste code above to less file
  2. Select place cursor inside "test2" name
  3. All instances/usages are highlighted
  4. Press Ctrl+R and type new name, confirm it with Enter

1. Paste code above to less file
  2. Select place cursor inside "attr" name
  3. All instances/usages are highlighted
  4. Press Ctrl+R and type new name, confirm it with Enter

1. Paste code above to less file
  2. Select place cursor inside "@j" name
  3. All instances/usages are highlighted
  4. Press Ctrl+R and type new name, confirm it with Enter

1. Run index file in attached project in Chrome with NB integration or in Embedded browser
  2. Use inspect mode to select either div or span element

CSS Styles shows information that given rule is generated and changes will be lost after recompilation. If you double click on css property or rule in either Properties or Applied rules part of CSS Styles window, proper scss file is opened. If you double click on property in Rule Editor part, generated css file is opened

1. Run the sample project in browser with NB integration
  2. open main.less and change color @color variable

1. Go to Tools|Options|Miscellaneous|CSS Preprocessors and disable "Generate extra information (debug)" for LESS compiler
  2. re-save your less file
Generated CSS file no longer contains debug information
Absolute path where attachments are being saved to
Absolute path where images are being saved to

Prerequisites: Set up device in Android emulator and start emulator

Web inspection works only on either iOS Simulator or iOS Device. So you need to have Mac OS and Developer certificate to be able to debug. If you have it, you can follow sanity specification for web inspection STS_74_WebInspection, you can skip "Browser extension" test suite and you must use Cordova project, e.g. sample Map project

Sample project TS_74_LessSupport_Less_debug.zip Create a new HTML5 project and use the link above as a template. Once project is created, go to project properties and enable Less compiler Following requires to have checked option "Generate extra information (debug)" for LESS compiler in Tools|Options|Miscellaneous|CSS Preprocessors. This property generates information into target css file that help to identify source less file.
